definition.text: To enable websockets communications from the UI to Superalgos Clients, we need to read the config of the Network Node. If anything is wrong with that configuration, the UI will not be able to communicate with the Client via websockets and many things, like running a Task will not be possible.

paragraphs.text: There are several reasons for the UI Web Sockets Client to report a Bad Configuration error. They are all listed below.
Invalid JSON Format
Reason #1: Invalid JSON Format

To enable websockets communications from the UI to Superalgos Clients, we need to read the config of the Network Node. In this case this configuration is unreadable because is not correctly formatted in JSON.
Bad Configuration - Invalid JSON Format
Edit the configuration and double check that is correctly formatted. If needed, copy the text to an online JSON formatter to see clearly which is the problem.

This page contains several error conditions. When clicking at the Error Menssage at a node, you are redirected within this page to the section where the the error that is happening at that node is explained.
Host Property Not Found
Reason #2: Host Property Not Found
The following property was expected and not found at the Network Node config:
host
Bad Configuration - Host Property Not Found
Double check that you did not misspell this property. It's value should be the hostName or IP number of the computer / server hosting the Superalgos Client.

This page contains several error conditions. When clicking at the Error Menssage at a node, you are redirected within this page to the section where the the error that is happening at that node is explained.
WebSocketsPort Property Not Found
Reason #3: WebSocketsPort Property Not Found
The following property was expected and not found at the Network Node config:
webSocketsPort
Error: Bad Configuration - WebSocketsPort Property Not Found
Tip: Double check that you did not misspell this property. It's value should be the port number configured for the Client Websockets Interface.

This page contains several error conditions. When clicking at the Error Menssage at a node, you are redirected within this page to the section where the the error that is happening at that node is explained.
